result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel E Pennington

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:28 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing. Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court.  Attorney Brandon Carlson, for attorney Peter M Wolff, in court for Daniel E Pennington.  Atty. Carlson provides an update; he notes the defendant has a case in Dodge Co. which is set to resolve on November 17th.  Atty. Carlson is asking the matter be set for status after November 17th.  State has no objection.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

08:49 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Reider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he has discovery and an offer.  Atty. Wolff is requesting a plea and sentencing in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:04 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he has discovery and an offer.  Atty. Wolff notes the defendant is in the process of getting into some treatment and is requesting 1 more further proceedings date.  No comment from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

08:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he has discovery but is waiting on an offer.  Ms. Voge has emailed the offer to Atty. Wolff in court today.  Court adjourns for further proceedings in about 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:16 AM Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:11 AM Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court with attorney Ronald Sonderhouse for attorney Peter M Wolff.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant given a copy of the amended criminal complaint.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.   Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Atty. Peter Wolff
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on March 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court notes the defendant qualifies for Public Defender Representation and at this time they have made 28 contacts, however, no attorney has agreed to represent the defendant.  The defendant states he made a $300.00 payment to WCS last week.  The Court admonishes the defendant and will direct the defendant to go to WCS immediately after Court today to clear up this issue.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Dated 02-08-2022 - Filed by Waukesha Public Defender's Office, reporting that despite their best efforts, the SPD has not secured representation as of today.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 02-07-22 received and filed.
WCS Non-Payment Report
Hearing on February 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:39 AM Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant states he is trying to retain an attorney. 
The Court notes that the Defendant was NOT eligible for the SPD.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.

The Court address the WCS non compliance letter.
The State takes no position at this time.
The Court admonishes the Defendant and will take no action at this time.  Hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 1/24/2022 received and filed.
Hearing on January 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel E Pennington
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-05-2022)
Prior: W223n7940 Plainview Pkwy, Sussex, WI 53089

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

02:34 PM Defendant Daniel E Pennington in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jensen appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
